thread.title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 1
thread.title_full: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 1 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 1
text:
Shawn Pinkston Shawn Pinkston Age: 41
Residence: Daniel Island
Occupation: Attorney
Education: Bachelor’s degree in history, Berea College; JD, St. Louis School of Law
Political experience: None
Contact information: (843) 817-4443, shawn@shawnpinkston.com , www.shawnpinkston.com
How I spend my spare time: With my two kids, charitable organizations, Crossfit, reading and watersports.
What makes me qualified for this office: Volunteering for the Army after 9/11 and deploying to Iraq, I understand putting service to others first. I’m active in charitable organizations and have a proven track record of giving back.
If elected, my top priority would be: Addressing congestion, fulfilling the promises made to Daniel Island in the Master Development Agreement (including services not being provided despite our taxes paying for them), and implementing recommendations from the Tourism Management Plan.
Gary White Age: 42
Residence: Daniel Island
Occupation: business banking manager
Education: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, College of Charleston, MBA, The Citadel
Political experience: Charleston City Council member since 2007
Contact information: (843) 364-1876; whiteforcouncil@gmail.com ; www.facebook.com/garywhitecitycouncil
How I spend my spare time: My family and I enjoy boating, fishing and playing tennis.
What makes me qualified for this office: I understand how to work with multiple groups of people to achieve common goals, how to effectively keep people informed, and how to complete projects in a fiscally responsible manner.
If elected, my top priority would be: Build a community and indoor recreation center to serve the Daniel Island and Cainhoy communities, implement the city’s tourism management plan, and improve traffic and transportation on Clements Ferry Road.
